solution_line_template: There are {passengers_per_car_initial} passengers and {driver_per_car} driver in each car, which means that in each car there are {passengers_per_car_initial} passengers + {driver_per_car} driver = <<{passengers_per_car_initial}+{driver_per_car}={people_per_car_initial}>>{people_per_car_initial} people.

This means there are a total of {num_cars} cars * {people_per_car_initial} people per car = <<{num_cars}*{people_per_car_initial}={total_people_initial}>>{total_people_initial} people in the car at the start of the race.

At the halfway point, there is an additional {num_cars} cars * {additional_passenger_per_car} additional passenger = <<{num_cars}*{additional_passenger_per_car}={additional_people_halfway}>>{additional_people_halfway} more people.

So be the end of the race, there are {total_people_initial} people at the start of the race + {additional_people_halfway} additional people = <<{total_people_initial}+{additional_people_halfway}={total_people_end_of_race}>>{total_people_end_of_race} people in the cars.
